DGACM.relevance_comment: Directs the Secretary-General “to provide, within the limits of existing resources and available funds, the necessary assistance for the successful organization of the International Tourist Year, including the widespread dissemination of information on its objectives.” This creates an obligation on the Secretariat to provide assistance and to disseminate information — activities that map directly to DGACM’s publishing, documentation and dissemination functions (publishing products, distribution, and information dissemination services described in the PPB).

Requests the Secretary-General to prepare, in co-operation with the International Union of Official Travel Organizations, and to submit to the Economic and Social Council a report on the International Tourist Year. Preparing and submitting the report is a Secretariat task that will require documentation, editorial, publication and dissemination work — functions DGACM’s PPB identifies (documentation services, publishing and issuing Secretariat reports and documents).

Subparagraph (a) of the report request specifies content to be included (description of programmes and activities undertaken), which implies preparation, compilation and publication of documentary material. Those are core DGACM tasks (translation/editing/desktop publishing, simultaneous issuance and dissemination) set out in its PPB.

Subparagraph (b) of the report request specifies an assessment of results achieved, which likewise requires Secretariat compilation, analysis and publication of documentary material — work that would be implemented through DGACM’s documentation/publishing services as described in its PPB.
